newsitem.title: UK: Sims Food falls on accounting problems.
newsitem.headline: Sims Food falls on accounting problems.

text.p: Meat processing firm Sims Food Group Plc saw its shares fall three pence to 30 after the company said it uncovered a breakdown in financial controls at its Carnaby plant.
This may show that management accounts have overstated profits by up to 1.7 million stg for the year to March 31, 1997 and lead to losses of up to 15 million stg at the plant.
But Sims Food added it does not expect its operating profits to differ materially from market expectations.
Second half trading was ahead of expectations in other operations, which should enable the group to report real progress when the full-year results come out in July, Sims Food said.
The irregularities at the Carnaby plant are, meanwhile, being investigated by independent accounts.
